sections.heading: ABSTRACT
text: The central claim of the paper is that NL stringeets are regular.
Three independent arguments are offered in favor of this position: one based on parsimony considerations, one employing the McCullogh-Pitts (1943) model of neuruns, and a purely linguistic one.
It Is possible to derive explicit upper bounds for the number of (live) states in XI acceptors: the results show that finite state NL parsers can be implemented on present-day computers.
The position of NI stringsets within the regular family is also investigated: it is proved that NIB are counter-free, tut not locally testable.
